titlestmt.titleproper: George and Madeline Jones Walenta papers 1885-1917
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: George and Madeline Jones Walenta papers

bioghist.p: George John Walenta (b. 1874) was a 1901 graduate of Haverford. He was rector of the Church of St. Simeon in Philadelphia. His wife, Madeline Jones Walenta (d. 1967), was the daughter of Richard M. and Virginia C. Jones. She was a member of Haverford Monthly Meeting.

scopecontent.p: This is a small collection of the personal papers of George and Madeline Walenta. Materials include letters, school papers, artwork, photographs, programs from the William Penn Charter School and the Church of St. Simeon. The collection also includes several of Madeline Jones's travel diaries (1896-1897).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Haverford College: Richard M. Jones papers.
